segment.source: title: Create your first app
segment.target: title: Create your first app

segment.source: description: It's easier than you think to create a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app for Windows 10.
segment.target: description: It's easier than you think to create a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app for Windows 10.

segment.source: Create your first app
segment.target: Create your first app

segment.source: It's easier than you think to create a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app for Windows 10.
segment.target: It's easier than you think to create a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app for Windows 10.

segment.source: You don't need to learn a new language to start—you can create it with what you already know:
segment.target: You don't need to learn a new language to start—you can create it with what you already know:

segment.source: C# or Visual Basic with XAML
segment.target: C# or Visual Basic with XAML

segment.source: C++ with XAML
segment.target: C++ with XAML

segment.source: JavaScript with HTML/CSS
segment.target: JavaScript with HTML/CSS

segment.source: These tutorials help you create your first UWP app in the language of your choice.
segment.target: These tutorials help you create your first UWP app in the language of your choice.

segment.source: Here, you'll learn how to:
segment.target: Here, you'll learn how to:

segment.source: Create a UWP app project in Microsoft Visual Studio.
segment.target: Create a UWP app project in Microsoft Visual Studio.

segment.source: Add UI elements and code to the project.
segment.target: Add UI elements and code to the project.

segment.source: Build and debug your app on the local machine and on a phone emulator.
segment.target: Build and debug your app on the local machine and on a phone emulator.

segment.source: To get started, choose the language you prefer.
segment.target: To get started, choose the language you prefer.

segment.source: C#/Visual Basic and XAML tutorials
segment.target: C#/Visual Basic and XAML tutorials

segment.source: Use your .NET, WPF, or Silverlight skills to build apps using XAML with C# or Visual Basic.
segment.target: Use your .NET, WPF, or Silverlight skills to build apps using XAML with C# or Visual Basic.

segment.source: Create a "Hello, world" app using XAML with C# or VB
segment.target: Create a "Hello, world" app using XAML with C# or VB

segment.source: We assume you're already comfortable with XAML and either C# or Visual Basic.
segment.target: We assume you're already comfortable with XAML and either C# or Visual Basic.

segment.source: If you want to learn the basics, or just refresh your memory, try these courses from the Microsoft Virtual Academy.
segment.target: If you want to learn the basics, or just refresh your memory, try these courses from the Microsoft Virtual Academy.

segment.source: C# Fundamentals for Absolute Beginners
segment.target: C# Fundamentals for Absolute Beginners

segment.source: VB Fundamentals for Absolute Beginners
segment.target: VB Fundamentals for Absolute Beginners

segment.source: XAML Deep Dive for Windows & Windows Phone Apps Jump Start
segment.target: XAML Deep Dive for Windows & Windows Phone Apps Jump Start

segment.source: Visual C++ component extensions (C++/CX) and XAML tutorials
segment.target: Visual C++ component extensions (C++/CX) and XAML tutorials

segment.source: Take advantage of your C++ programming expertise to build apps using Visual C++ component extensions (C++/CX) with XAML .
segment.target: Take advantage of your C++ programming expertise to build apps using Visual C++ component extensions (C++/CX) with XAML .

segment.source: Create a "Hello, world" app using XAML with C++/CX
segment.target: Create a "Hello, world" app using XAML with C++/CX

segment.source: We assume you're already comfortable with XAML and C++.
segment.target: We assume you're already comfortable with XAML and C++.

segment.source: If you want to learn the basics, or just refresh your memory, try these courses from the Microsoft Virtual Academy.
segment.target: If you want to learn the basics, or just refresh your memory, try these courses from the Microsoft Virtual Academy.

segment.source: C++: A General Purpose Language and Library Jump Start
segment.target: C++: A General Purpose Language and Library Jump Start

segment.source: XAML Deep Dive for Windows & Windows Phone Apps Jump Start
segment.target: XAML Deep Dive for Windows & Windows Phone Apps Jump Start

segment.source: JavaScript and HTML tutorials
segment.target: JavaScript and HTML tutorials

segment.source: Take advantage of your web skills to build apps using HTML5, Cascading Style Sheets, Level 3 (CSS3), and JavaScript.
segment.target: Take advantage of your web skills to build apps using HTML5, Cascading Style Sheets, Level 3 (CSS3), and JavaScript.

segment.source: Create a "Hello, world" app using HTML and JavaScript
segment.target: Create a "Hello, world" app using HTML and JavaScript

segment.source: We assume you're already comfortable with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
segment.target: We assume you're already comfortable with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.

segment.source: If you want to learn the basics, or just refresh your memory, try these courses from the Microsoft Virtual Academy.
segment.target: If you want to learn the basics, or just refresh your memory, try these courses from the Microsoft Virtual Academy.

segment.source: JavaScript Fundamentals for Absolute Beginners
segment.target: JavaScript Fundamentals for Absolute Beginners

segment.source: HTML5 & CSS3 Fundamentals for Absolute Beginners
segment.target: HTML5 & CSS3 Fundamentals for Absolute Beginners

segment.source: Other resources
segment.target: Other resources

segment.source: If you want to develop games using C++ and Microsoft DirectX, see Developing games on Windows 10.
segment.target: If you want to develop games using C++ and Microsoft DirectX, see Developing games on Windows 10.

segment.source: Already have experience with iOS or Android?
segment.target: Already have experience with iOS or Android?

segment.source: The Porting apps to Windows 10 section has resources to help you get started.
segment.target: The Porting apps to Windows 10 section has resources to help you get started.
